newsitem.title: SPAIN: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.

text.p: Spanish government bonds closed a little lower, tracking other markets after a lacklustre trading day, with very little volume especially on the cash side.
"I saw more business in the futures," said Gregorio Gomez at All trading in Madrid.
"But I have to admit very little was going on. It could be a signal that the Spanish market is starting to be tired,"he said.

Bonos are likely to wait until next week to consolidate, dealers said. With the U.S. holiday ahead, Spanish dealers rule out big movements on Thursday. "I expect our market to stay in a narrow trading range tomorrow," said one.
On the long-term bond futures, analysts put resistance at 111.67 and support at 111.12.
The 10-year spread over German Bunds was trading at 131 basis points, unchanged from yesterday, while the differential over Italian bonds widened as expected above 50 bps.
On the short end of the yield curve, dealers saw buying interest in the three-year segment. The three year 7.80 percent bond closed at 104.41 from 104.43 yesterday.
Economy Minister Rodrigo Rato's remarks on the recovery of the Spanish economy had little impact on prices, dealers said.
